summary.overview: The Notes App allows users to create, edit, and delete notes. Users can add new notes, edit existing ones using a toggle between a textarea and a display mode, and delete notes. The application uses localStorage to persist notes across sessions.
summary.predefined_options: The application does not have predefined options for note content; users start with an empty note or edit existing ones.
summary.external_resources: Font Awesome icons for buttons (plus, edit, delete) sourced from a CDN.
summary.external_js_libraries: Marked.js for Markdown rendering, sourced from a CDN.

requirements.description: When the user clicks the 'Add note' button, a new note is created and displayed on the page with an empty textarea for input.
When the user types into the textarea of a note, the content is rendered in Markdown format in the main display area of the note.
When the user clicks the 'Edit' button on a note, the note toggles between displaying the main content and the editable textarea.
When the user clicks the 'Delete' button on a note, the note is removed from the page and the localStorage is updated to reflect this change.
When the page loads, any notes stored in localStorage are retrieved and displayed on the page.
When the user inputs text into the textarea, the application updates the localStorage with the current state of all notes.
